title: What is the minimal sentense that would get you banned on Ruqqus?

body:
Someone got banned for saying "gas the jannies" apparently. 

Doesn't seem like tangible threat to me, but sure why that's banworthy. Unless it was something else.

body:

body:
Thanks for the link.

The Ruqqus admins need to be extremely cautious about bans. The whole point of this is free speech. People will just go back to Reddit, or God forbid, Voat if they see that freedom of speech is curtailed.

post.body: What is the minimal sentense that would get you banned on Ruqqus?
post.body_html: What is the minimal sentense that would get you banned on Ruqqus?
post.title: What is the minimal sentense that would get you banned on Ruqqus?

body:
Voat is a shithole, but it has been unfaltering in its defence of genuine freedom of speech. It's no fault of Voat's that it is the way it is - it's the fault of those capable of challenging the ideas of those who use Voat being too unwilling to make the migration to Voat when reddit began to show its true colours 5 and 6 years ago.

Why is ruqqus any better? Isn't it, rather, that certain users with certain ideas came to ruqqus now instead of Voat five years ago? And why is that the case? Because the hammer only now fell on them.
body_html:
Voat is a shithole, but it has been unfaltering in its defence of genuine freedom of speech. It's no fault of Voat's that it is the way it is - it's the fault of those capable of challenging the ideas of those who use Voat being too unwilling to make the migration to Voat when reddit began to show its true colours 5 and 6 years ago.

Why is ruqqus any better? Isn't it, rather, that certain users with certain ideas came to ruqqus now instead of Voat five years ago? And why is that the case? Because the hammer only now fell on them.

body: He was probably testing the waters, to see how far he could push things. Evidently he found out. The important question for us is, is the straw that broke the camel's back really something that should warrant a ban on a freedom of speech website? Without transparent moderator / admin logs, there's no way for us to judge.
body_html: He was probably testing the waters, to see how far he could push things. Evidently he found out. The important question for us is, is the straw that broke the camel's back really something that should warrant a ban on a freedom of speech website? Without transparent moderator / admin logs, there's no way for us to judge.

post.body: What is the minimal sentense that would get you banned on Ruqqus?
post.body_html: What is the minimal sentense that would get you banned on Ruqqus?
post.title: What is the minimal sentense that would get you banned on Ruqqus?

body:
I think there is a point if someone's spamming the same 3 words in every comment they should be stopped. If everybody here did that it would become difficult or impossible to have any real discussions.

Saying your piece is one thing, but i've seen some of these people who are claiming to "Test the censorship" spam every comment in a section with the same edgy crap when it had nothing to do with the things they were replying too.

I agree though there should be more transparency about bans, so the community can judge.
body_html:
I think there is a point if someone's spamming the same 3 words in every comment they should be stopped. If everybody here did that it would become difficult or impossible to have any real discussions.

Saying your piece is one thing, but i've seen some of these people who are claiming to "Test the censorship" spam every comment in a section with the same edgy crap when it had nothing to do with the things they were replying too.

I agree though there should be more transparency about bans, so the community can judge.

post.body: What is the minimal sentense that would get you banned on Ruqqus?
post.body_html: What is the minimal sentense that would get you banned on Ruqqus?
post.title: What is the minimal sentense that would get you banned on Ruqqus?

body:
Spam is definitely a legitimate reason to ban someone. If you go into a town square, or a movie theatre, and just start screaming non-stop at the top of your lungs, you're going to get thrown out or arrested. Without modlogs, it's hard to tell if that's what the case here was - and if so, the ban reason should have been "spam" not "advocating violence".

Since it seems to have been "advocating violence", I think it's important we know what the line is. I would think, according to ruqqus principles about the second amendment, that it would have to be more than generic statements about killing all [insert hated racial group here]. Then again, maybe that much is sufficient. But it would be good to know.
body_html:
Spam is definitely a legitimate reason to ban someone. If you go into a town square, or a movie theatre, and just start screaming non-stop at the top of your lungs, you're going to get thrown out or arrested. Without modlogs, it's hard to tell if that's what the case here was - and if so, the ban reason should have been "spam" not "advocating violence".

Since it seems to have been "advocating violence", I think it's important we know what the line is. I would think, according to ruqqus principles about the second amendment, that it would have to be more than generic statements about killing all [insert hated racial group here]. Then again, maybe that much is sufficient. But it would be good to know.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

body: They might have to be extra-cautious because there is no shortage of AHS-minded people who work in government. Since Ruqqus is small, Reddit or some other company may abuse this to try and take Ruqqus down, or slander it as another racist site like Voat.

parent.body:
Someone got banned for saying "gas the jannies" apparently. 

Doesn't seem like tangible threat to me, but sure why that's banworthy. Unless it was something else.
